node.data: {"title":"Workshops","details":["This event is all about learning so we prepared a few workshops to help you brush up on your Python, start anew with introductions in AI and ML and get a better grasp of some NLP concepts like preprocessing techniques and transformers.","All courses taking place during these 3 days are open for everyone to join (so you don't need to be registered for the competition).","Links and details of these workshops will be made available here and on our social media pages."],"github":"Workshop materials can be found on our GitHub: ","inviteTitle":"Special Guest","descriptions":{"Python":"Introduction to main Python programming concepts with a core on machine learning, data processing and visualization modules such as numpy, pandas and matplotlib.","ML":"Implementing two end-to-end machine learning pipelines for text classification and introducing core concepts along the way.","Linguistics":"This talk is a glimpse into the linguistics problems. Participants will experience first-hand these problemsâ€™ approach and the way an algorithm will process such information.","Psychology":"","NLP":"An introduction to fundamental applied NLP concepts. The discourse will address feature engineering practices in NLP, as well as the relevant Python libraries and ML models evaluation methodology.","DL":"Introducing feed forward neural networks along with implementing the models and training procedures using the Pytorch framework.","Transformers":"Brief introduction to transfer learning for NLP covering word embeddings - with emphasis on Word2Vec & the Transformer, for which we will then showcase how pre-trained models can \"reuse\" knowledge."}}
